definitions.definition: A spending or consuming, often a disbursement of funds .
examples: She went to great expense to ensure her children would get the best education.
Buying the car was a big expense , but will be worth it in the long run.
We had a training weekend in New York, at the expense of our company.

definitions.definition: The elimination or consumption of something, sometimes with the notion of loss or damage to the thing eliminated.
examples: Jones reached the final at the expense of Smith, who couldn't beat him.

main_definition: A spending or consuming, often a disbursement of funds .
secondary_definitions: The elimination or consumption of something, sometimes with the notion of loss or damage to the thing eliminated.
